events.message: The applicant has submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses, providing initial financial details and contact information.
Loan team categorised the application under 'Personal Loan' due to the stated purpose related to medical bills and absence of property or business keywords.
A personal loan officer with experience in medical expense cases has been assigned to manage and review the applicant's file moving forward.
The loan officer has conducted an initial review, verifying submitted data and preparing a checklist for additional documentation required for deeper assessment.
Applicant was requested to provide medical bills, proof of income, and identification documents to support the evaluation of the personal loan application.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested medical invoices, latest pay slips, bank statements, and a valid government-issued ID.
A credit check was performed revealing a moderate credit score with no recent defaults or delinquencies, supporting loan responsibility potential.
Risk analysts have completed the evaluation factoring medical expense context, credit history, and debt-to-income ratio to assess overall repayment risk.
The loan officer presented the applicant with an offer including a 24-month term, fixed interest rate, and a detailed repayment schedule.
Applicant responded positively, confirming understanding of terms and expressing intention to accept the personal loan offer for medical bills coverage.
After thorough assessment, the personal loan was formally approved by the lending committee to support the applicant's medical expense needs.
Funds were disbursed to the applicant's bank account successfully, enabling prompt payment of the outstanding medical bills and related costs.
The loan officer contacted the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and satisfaction with the loan service, offering assistance if needed.
The loan application case was officially closed after successful fund disbursal and positive feedback confirming resolution of medical financing.
